title: Revisiting Cambodias Killing Fields 30 years later

tasks.task: Travel to Cambodia in 1986 for initial assessment
subtasks: Gather information on post-war agricultural conditions
Identify needs for genetic conservation and variety improvement
Collaborate with surviving agricultural experts from IRI
Organize gene bank storage and reintroduction efforts
Translate training materials and implement English courses for Cambodians
Conduct extensive farmer training in rice production and English
Facilitate higher education for Cambodian researchers (Masters, PhDs) abroad

tasks.task: Expand agronomy, pest management, and post-harvest technology
subtasks: Improve post-harvest handling and storage techniques

tasks.task: Monitor and adapt farming practices post-Green Revolution
subtasks: Transition from traditional to high-yielding rice varieties
Balance traditional knowledge with modern agricultural techniques

tasks.task: Foster international collaboration for research and development
subtasks: Establish linkages between Cambodian institutions and global research
Encourage knowledge exchange with neighboring countries

tasks.task: Achieve sustained agricultural recovery and export success
subtasks: Revitalize rice production from hundred-fold post-war output to current levels
Restore Cambodia’s role as an exporter of rice into international markets
